abstract: Rising number of high-achieving New York City high school students are taking summer classes at prestigious schools in hopes of burnishing their academic records and increasing chances of acceptance by elite colleges; critics say option, unavailable to many low-income students, is widening already stark achievement gap.
lead_paragraph: High-achieving students are enrolling to turbocharge grade-point averages or load up on advanced courses, but critics say the practice only adds to the inequities of the college admissions process.
snippet: High-achieving students are enrolling to turbocharge grade-point averages or load up on advanced courses, but critics say the practice only adds to the inequities of the college admissions process....

headline.main: Taking Summer School to Get Ahead, Not Catch Up
headline.print_headline: High Achievers Seeking  Edge in College Search  Turn to Summer School
